channel.title: Internet problem
channel.description:
I've got a problem with my PC - I connect to the router through a wireless adaptor using Realtek software. Since about 2 days ago, the adapter will connect to the wireless router, but will not connect to the www. All other computers using the wireless can connect no prob, and ive tried uninstalling and reinstalling the adapter. I've also just got O2 installed today, and it wont work on that wireless either, so im guessing it is something wrong with my system.
Has anyone got any suggestions on fixes?

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

hmm. I’ve not been able to connect since my first post, until about 3 minutes ago when it randomly started working…?

I still have no idea what the problem is, and I thank most of you for your helpful replies.

Hello again Sep! How have you been?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

The true question is… who was phone?

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Is the computer turned on?

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @_Sep `Sep
item.description:
@_Sep wrote:

Well hello there Chris. Long time no see?

I’d second what chrisn2323 said. Check the TCP/IP settings. Maybe you’ve got it set up statically and have some conflicting values in there?

Does the wifi adapter in question work on other computers in the same network?

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Mr.Chris:

I’ve also just got O2 installed today, and it wont work on that wireless either, so im guessing it is something wrong with my system.

One of those wireless cards that connects using the mobile network? If yes, you’re right this has nothing to do with your router and is almost definitely your system. Do you have a firewall running? Web protection on avast completely disabled internet access for me once for no apparent reason, so I just turned it off.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ummmm routers don’t have to “recognise hardware”

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Try unplugging the router and then try reconnecting, this normally solves my problems, it has something to do with the router not recognizing the new hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet problem
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

it could be a number of things.

Do you know for sure that you set it up right? (dhcp, static etc.)

Read full topic
